title: What are electrical gadgets and their uses? - Quora

response.answer_text: The different sources that have researched about the electricity and use of the electronic gadgets they have found the improvement of technology that has made the use of electricity in the gadgets a must. The consumption of electricity by the electronic gadget is going to increase year by year. The sharing of electricity consumption by the gadgets and appliances are rising continuously and so the different people are trying to bring in alternative sources of energy. The alternate energy has a limit as the sun will not shine in a cloudy day and you will not be able to use the solar energy. The wind energy will be available when the wind blows and the other forms have their own ways to combat and electricity has given the humans a new understanding through the computer and camera and different equipment that each profession uses. The electronics are used in the toys of the kids and the machines that they use for playing games are also electronic good. The gadgets like smart phones, hair dryer, camera and mixer grinder and the electronic cooker a thousand other things that are use as electronic goods and gadgets. When you buy an appliance you must calculate the cost of the extra electricity that will be used from your home. The appliances at home are used to keep your home clean and tidy but here you are trying to buy the gadget that you think will help you to communicate with your friends or to be the most talked about gadget freak. You do not think about the way the people work with different gadgets that are mostly appliance that are electronic working gadgets like the dehumidifier, microwave oven and computers and home theaters. The different gadgets that are used in different field of life are mostly run by electricity and are becoming a friend of yours throughout the day in fun and frolic.

Errrm…where do I start? OK, since you're asking this kind of question I'll assume you know pretty much next to nothing about the natural sciences (am I wrong?) and engineering too. So to give you a brighter picture of what electrical gadgets are, I'll give a few random examples, known by everyone. Here we go… Your hair dryerPressing ironTelevisionSpeakersFanAC unitComputersWashing machineElectric stoveRefrigeratorFlashlightsPhew! Notice anything common to all the examples given? Of course you do - they all run on electricity (even the ones that run on batteries). So, electrical gadgets/appliances are devices that require electrical power for their operation. While their unifying factor is the fact that they all run on electricity, their uses are quite different, specific to each device. Now look back up to the examples and think up a use for each gadget. Cheers!
